Bo&rrot;wes tunes wodes and wo&combmacr;ges wonges A folio has here been cut out of the MS., containing 180 lines. The missing po&rrot;tion mu&slong;t have been to this effect. To this they gladly assented; and Havelok, accompanied by his wife Goldebo&rrot;w and the sons of Grim, set sail fo&rrot; Denmark. Disembarking, they travel till they reach the ca&slong;tle of a great Danish earl, named Ubbe, who had fo&rrot;merly been a close friend to king Birkabeyn. Havelok begs that he will allow him to live in that part of the country, and to gain a livelihood by trading.
